StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Time at university was over. [PAUSE] Although unsure about what to do next, a gut feeling made clear that dropping by Professor Eucalyptus's office would yield something useful.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: A job? In this economy? Archaeology degree.... Hmmmm.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hmmmm. [PAUSE] Hmmmmmmmmmmmm...
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: I know! [PAUSE] The old museum... Yes! I have a job for you. But it will require grit, dedication and a lot of digging!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: A museum?
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Yes! The old museum in my town, where I used to work during the summers! It is a rundown dingy place nowadays. But the town is in need of some help, and few are willing to take on the task.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Alright, professor, I don't have a better idea. I'll take on the museum.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Good, good. Ever since I laid eyes on you in my class that year, I knew you had something special about you. Meet me at the _______ Bus Stop. I'll explain the rest when you get there. Oh, and be sure to pack enough stuff to stay for a while.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Alright. We're here.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Wonderful! The bus arrived right on time. It's good to see you [PLAYERNAME].
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Come! Grab your things. Let me show you your new home! It's quite literally right around the corner!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: So, I'm not going to lie to you. [PAUSE]. But, you'll have a good bit of work to do here.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Before I let you unpack and all. Let me give you a basic tour of the place.[TRIGGERTUTORIAL]
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: The place is quite small, but I think there is room for expansion. The entire strip of trees in the back there is owned by the museum! Which in turn is owned by the city council.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: But, here. Let me get you started. Here's an old tomahawk my family has passed down for generations. It's said it was given to my great, great grandpa by a local Native American chief.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Now, let me see you put this in that old exhibit over there.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Good job!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: There's a lot of cleaning, remodelling and of course, artifact-hunting to be done before this museum returns to its glory days.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Speaking of artifacts, a possible ancient battle site has been identified around these parts. And I've managed to secure a permit for you and the museum to go excavating there.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: That's awesome! I can finally be a real archaeologist!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hold your horses! You still need a digging assistant, and I, for one, am too busy with the university. See if someone in town is willing to help you out. Meanwhile, I'll get some dinner.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Heck yea! The museum is coming back! My name is Alex! I'd love to help you find cool ancient stuff! I know so many World War 2 fun facts!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Alex

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Good. You've found someone already!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Tomorrow you will go digging for the first time. I'll meet you first thing in the morning.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Rise and shine!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Ugh
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Wake up! Your buddy Alex has been waiting outside the museum. I had to use my old key to let us in!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hey [PLAYERNAME]! I can't wait to go excavating!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Alex

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Looks like you got the hang of it! Good luck down there!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Alex

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hey, before it gets too late, be sure to make your way to the surface! It's dangerous to stay down there too late at night.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Alex

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Looks like you had a productive first expedition. A couple of new artifacts will go a long way in helping the museum return to its glory days.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Actually, before you officially reopen the museum, I think you'll need a bit more help. I wonder if someone is willing to help run the ticket counter. Someone unscrupulous... and organized.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: *Knock* *Knock*
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hey. I'm Emily from down the street. I've been noticing some ruckus about the museum.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Am I correct in assuming that the museum is opening again?
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Well... whattaya know?
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Young lady, are you, by any chance, in need of a job?
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: You kidding? I'd happily take a gig at a museum in this economy.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Well [PLAYERNAME], it looks like some problems sort themselves out.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Looks like we have a small team going!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Once you think the museum is ready. Come speak to me and we will officially open!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Oh my... I haven't been this excited since I was about your age!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hey, is anyone there?
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Hey! I'm [PlayerName]. I'm working at the museum now. The Professor and I are trying to fix it up.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Wow! You wouldn't know it yet, but that could be big news for the town. This museum used to be a big draw around these parts. Loads of people from all across the state would come by. Brought a good bit of traffic for the local businesses.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Gosh!! Where are my manners?! My name is Karla. I run a small logging business from the town here.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: It's still got the rights to this big patch of trees in the back here. If you ever need to expand. You let me know!
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Portrait

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: How are you settling in, [PlayerName]? I see the museum is coming along quite well.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: From one former museum keeper to another, I suggest you contemplate theming your artifacts.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Theming?
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Theming. That's right. If you have objects that can be tagged similarly displayed close to one another in a designated zone, the museum' guests will be much more appreciative of the history of the objects in question.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Imagine an iron sword from the medieval age sat next to an iron spearhead from the ancient age. The guests are more likely to apprecaite the evolution of iron weaponry through the ages.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: I think I get it.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Player

StorySceneEntries.Dialogue: Don't worry it is quite simple. All artifacts have tags. If you have different artifacts with matching tags in a particular zone, you'll notice these artifacts are scored higher, and do wonders for your ticket sales, and your overall museum rating too.
StorySceneEntries.Speaker: Professor Eucalyptus
